newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Aug 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Aug 22.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following business stories on August 22:
NEW YORK - The threat of new federal regulation and more lawsuits sent tobacco stocks down sharply.
WASHINGTON - Mayor Marion Barry's administration is trying to work out a tax deferment agreement with the Bureau of National Affairs Inc. to keep the newsletter publisher from moving to the suburbs.
WASHINGTON - Hechinger Co, the home improvement retailer based in Landover, reported a second-quarter profit of $12.2 million.
BUDAPEST - Hungary's largest fun park, beset by the country's socialist legacy and a new era, is for sale.
WASHINGTON - The International Trade Commission ruled that Japanese and German manufacturers violated trade laws by selling large printing presses to U.S. publishers at below-market prices.
